Lack enough support: The experts point out that the Biden campaign did not provide any evidence to support the claim that individuals were not allowed to own cannons during the Revolutionary War.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there were restrictions on individual ownership of cannons during the Revolutionary War period, but historians are doubtful about the existence of such laws.
Exist alternative explanation: The experts mention that there were instances of privately owned vessels with cannons during the period, suggesting that there may not have been a complete ban on individual ownership of cannons.
Contradict fact: The experts contradict the claim by stating that historians are dubious about the existence of laws against private cannon ownership during the Revolutionary War.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the legal framework during the Revolutionary War period, as the experts describe it as haphazard.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in its accuracy due to the lack of evidence and the doubts raised by historians.
